Comments_List: 15 hours per week; 10 during spring break and finals

I really appreciated the opportunity to practice the research skills that I learned during my first year of the MPH program. It showed me what research looks like as a career, real-world practices, common issues, etc. 

I built a great relationship with my PI, who also introduced me to other researchers at Yale who I would have never met if I had just taken another class. I also got to build actual research experience for my resume, which was super influential when I was job searching for post-grad life.

Working with the Cornell Scott Hill Health Center took longer than expected to get going on the project, but once the project was started it was a very exciting and interesting project- we were able to actively be engaged in the DM clinic and observe how the clinic runs each day. Moving forward, future projects with CSHHC may benefit from making sure that the necessary paperwork and forms are completed prior to starting the project.
Great opportunity to get practical experience while at YSPH.

Trace was very helpful in guiding our project and helping to provide information, tools, and feedback as we continued to work throughout the semester. For future semesters, it may be helpful for us to schedule more regularly meetings to check in with Trace to keep our project on track.
Great instructor/advisor in the project. Always willing and able to meet with us to provide guidance and feedback.
Great opportunity to practice research skills and gain real-world experience while in school.

Working with Cornell Scott has so far been an interesting and hands-on experience that has provided a "real life" opportunity to work with a local community heath clinic and interact with the providers and patients. If you are looking for this type of project to apply your public health skills in the New Haven community, I would highly recommend this course and Cornell Scott as a community partner!
Partnership with Cornell Scott Hill Helath Center to provide an evaluation plan and implement and evaluation of the Diabetes Clinic.
